Complete the following Lean 4 code:
```lean4
import Mathlib

open Nat Set MeasureTheory Topology Filter

/--
Let $\triangle ABC$ be any triangle in the Euclidean plane, and let points $X$, $Y$, and $Z$ lie on sides $\overline{BC}$, $\overline{CA}$, and $\overline{AB}$ respectively. If $BX \le XC$, $CY \le YA$, and $AZ \le ZB$, prove that $[\triangle XYZ] \ge \frac{1}{4} [\triangle ABC]$.  Regardless of this constraint on $X$, $Y$, and $Z$, prove that one of $[\triangle AZY]$, $[\triangle BXZ]$, or $[\triangle CYX]$ is less than or equal to $[\triangle XYZ]$. (Here, $[\triangle]$ denotes the area of triangle $\triangle$.)
-/
theorem putnam_1973_a1
(A B C X Y Z : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))
(hnoncol : ¬Collinear ℝ {A, B, C})
(hX : X ∈ segment ℝ B C)
(hY : Y ∈ segment ℝ C A)
(hZ : Z ∈ segment ℝ A B)
: ((dist B X ≤ dist X C ∧ dist C Y ≤ dist Y A ∧ dist A Z ≤ dist Z B) →
volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C})) ∧
sInf {volume (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}), volume (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}), volume (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})} ≤ volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1973_a1
(A B C X Y Z : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))
(hnoncol : ¬Collinear ℝ {A, B, C})
(hX : X ∈ segment ℝ B C)
(hY : Y ∈ segment ℝ C A)
(hZ : Z ∈ segment ℝ A B)
: ((dist B X ≤ dist X C ∧ dist C Y ≤ dist Y A ∧ dist A Z ≤ dist Z B) →
volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C})) ∧
sInf {volume (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}), volume (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}), volume (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})} ≤ volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) := by
  constructor
  · intro h
    have h₁ := h.1
    have h₂ := h.2.1
    have h₃ := h.2.2
    have h₄ : volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C}) := by
      -- Use the fact that the volume of the convex hull of three points is at least 1/4 of the volume of the convex hull of the original three points.
      field_simp [volume_convexHull_triple, abs_of_nonneg] at *
      <;>
      ring_nf at * <;>
      nlinarith [sq_nonneg (dist B X - dist X C), sq_nonneg (dist C Y - dist Y A), sq_nonneg (dist A Z - dist Z B),
        sq_nonneg (dist B X + dist X C), sq_nonneg (dist C Y + dist Y A), sq_nonneg (dist A Z + dist Z B)]
    exact h₄
  · have h₁ : sInf {volume (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}), volume (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}), volume (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})} ≤ volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) := by
      apply csInf_le
      exact bddBelow_triple_point_areas A B C X Y Z
      simp [hX, hY, hZ]
      <;>
      aesop
    exact h₁
```

import Mathlib

open Nat Set MeasureTheory Topology Filter

/--
Let $\triangle ABC$ be any triangle in the Euclidean plane, and let points $X$, $Y$, and $Z$ lie on sides $\overline{BC}$, $\overline{CA}$, and $\overline{AB}$ respectively. If $BX \le XC$, $CY \le YA$, and $AZ \le ZB$, prove that $[\triangle XYZ] \ge \frac{1}{4} [\triangle ABC]$.  Regardless of this constraint on $X$, $Y$, and $Z$, prove that one of $[\triangle AZY]$, $[\triangle BXZ]$, or $[\triangle CYX]$ is less than or equal to $[\triangle XYZ]$. (Here, $[\triangle]$ denotes the area of triangle $\triangle$.)
-/
theorem putnam_1973_a1
(A B C X Y Z : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))
(hnoncol : ¬Collinear ℝ {A, B, C})
(hX : X ∈ segment ℝ B C)
(hY : Y ∈ segment ℝ C A)
(hZ : Z ∈ segment ℝ A B)
: ((dist B X ≤ dist X C ∧ dist C Y ≤ dist Y A ∧ dist A Z ≤ dist Z B) →
volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C})) ∧
sInf {volume (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}), volume (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}), volume (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})} ≤ volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_1973_a1
(A B C X Y Z : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))
(hnoncol : ¬Collinear ℝ {A, B, C})
(hX : X ∈ segment ℝ B C)
(hY : Y ∈ segment ℝ C A)
(hZ : Z ∈ segment ℝ A B)
: ((dist B X ≤ dist X C ∧ dist C Y ≤ dist Y A ∧ dist A Z ≤ dist Z B) →
volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C})) ∧
sInf {volume (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}), volume (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}), volume (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})} ≤ volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) := by
  constructor
  · intro h
    have h₁ := h.1
    have h₂ := h.2.1
    have h₃ := h.2.2
    have h₄ : volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C}) := by
      -- Use the fact that the points X, Y, Z are in the segments to establish the inequality
      field_simp [volume_convexHull_of_card_three]
      ring_nf
      <;>
      nlinarith [hnoncol, hX, hY, hZ, dist_nonneg (B - X), dist_nonneg (C - Y), dist_nonneg (A - Z),
        dist_nonneg (X - B), dist_nonneg (Y - C), dist_nonneg (Z - A)]
    exact h₄
  · have h₁ : sInf {volume (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}), volume (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}), volume (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})} ≤ volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) := by
      apply csInf_le
      · exact bddBelow_finite {volume (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}), volume (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}), volume (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})}
      · simp
        <;>
        exact le_rfl
    exact h₁
```

```lean4
theorem putnam_1973_a1
(A B C X Y Z : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))
(hnoncol : ¬Collinear ℝ {A, B, C})
(hX : X ∈ segment ℝ B C)
(hY : Y ∈ segment ℝ C A)
(hZ : Z ∈ segment ℝ A B)
: ((dist B X ≤ dist X C ∧ dist C Y ≤ dist Y A ∧ dist A Z ≤ dist Z B) →
volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C})) ∧
sInf {volume (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}), volume (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}), volume (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})} ≤ volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) := by
  constructor
  · intro h
    have h₁ : volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C}) := by
      -- Use the given constraints and properties of triangles to establish the inequality
      field_simp [hnoncol, hX, hY, hZ, h]
      <;> ring_nf
      <;>
      nlinarith [hnoncol, hX, hY, hZ, h]
    exact h₁
  · have h₁ : sInf {volume (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}), volume (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}), volume (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})} ≤ volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) := by
      apply csInf_le
      · exact bddBelow_triple (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}) (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}) (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})
      · simp
    exact h₁

```lean4
import Mathlib

open Nat Set MeasureTheory Topology Filter

/--
Let $\triangle ABC$ be any triangle in the Euclidean plane, and let points $X$, $Y$, and $Z$ lie on sides $\overline{BC}$, $\overline{CA}$, and $\overline{AB}$ respectively. If $BX \le XC$, $CY \le YA$, and $AZ \le ZB$, prove that $[\triangle XYZ] \ge \frac{1}{4} [\triangle ABC]$.  Regardless of this constraint on $X$, $Y$, and $Z$, prove that one of $[\triangle AZY]$, $[\triangle BXZ]$, or $[\triangle CYX]$ is less than or equal to $[\triangle XYZ]$. (Here, $[\triangle]$ denotes the area of triangle $\triangle$.)
-/
theorem putnam_1973_a1
(A B C X Y Z : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))
(hnoncol : ¬Collinear ℝ {A, B, C})
(hX : X ∈ segment ℝ B C)
(hY : Y ∈ segment ℝ C A)
(hZ : Z ∈ segment ℝ A B)
: ((dist B X ≤ dist X C ∧ dist C Y ≤ dist Y A ∧ dist A Z ≤ dist Z B) →
volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C})) ∧
sInf {volume (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}), volume (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}), volume (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})} ≤ volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_1973_a1
(A B C X Y Z : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))
(hnoncol : ¬Collinear ℝ {A, B, C})
(hX : X ∈ segment ℝ B C)
(hY : Y ∈ segment ℝ C A)
(hZ : Z ∈ segment ℝ A B)
: ((dist B X ≤ dist X C ∧ dist C Y ≤ dist Y A ∧ dist A Z ≤ dist Z B) →
volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C})) ∧
sInf {volume (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}), volume (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}), volume (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})} ≤ volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) := by
  constructor
  · intro h
    have h₁ := h.1
    have h₂ := h.2.1
    have h₃ := h.2.2
    have h₄ : volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C}) := by
      -- Use the fact that the area of a triangle is related to the determinant of a matrix formed by its vertices.
      rw [show convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z} = convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z} by rfl]
      rw [show convexHull ℝ {A, B, C} = convexHull ℝ {A, B, C} by rfl]
      -- Use the fact that the area of a triangle is related to the determinant of a matrix formed by its vertices.
      refine' calc
        volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C}) := by
          -- Use the fact that the area of a triangle is related to the determinant of a matrix formed by its vertices.
          apply?
        _ = (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C}) := by rfl
    exact h₄
  · -- Show that the infimum of the areas of the three smaller triangles is less than or equal to the area of the main triangle.
    apply csInf_le
    -- Show that the set of areas of the three smaller triangles is nonempty and bounded below.
    exact?
```

open Nat Set MeasureTheory Topology Filter

/--
Let $\triangle ABC$ be any triangle in the Euclidean plane, and let points $X$, $Y$, and $Z$ lie on sides $\overline{BC}$, $\overline{CA}$, and $\overline{AB}$ respectively. If $BX \le XC$, $CY \le YA$, and $AZ \le ZB$, prove that $[\triangle XYZ] \ge \frac{1}{4} [\triangle ABC]$. theorem putnam_1973_a1
(A B C X Y Z : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))
(hnoncol : ¬Collinear ℝ {A, B, C})
(hX : X ∈ segment ℝ B C)
(hY : Y ∈ segment ℝ C A)
(hZ : Z ∈ segment ℝ A B)
: ((dist B X ≤ dist X C ∧ dist C Y ≤ dist Y A ∧ dist A Z ≤ dist Z B) →
volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C})) ∧
sInf {volume (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}), volume (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}), volume (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})} ≤ volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) := by
  constructor
  case left =>
    intro h
    have h₁ := h.1
    have h₂ := h.2.1
    have h₃ := h.2.2
    have h₄ : volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C}) := by
      -- Use the fact that the area of a triangle is related to the determinant of a matrix formed by its vertices.
      rw [show convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z} = convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z} by rfl]
      -- Use the fact that the area of a triangle is related to the determinant of a matrix formed by its vertices.
      have h₅ : volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C}) := by
        -- Use the fact that the area of a triangle is related to the determinant of a matrix formed by its vertices.
        field_simp [volume_convexHull_of_card_three]
        ring_nf
        <;>
        nlinarith [hnoncol, hX, hY, hZ, h₁, h₂, h₃,
          dist_nonneg (B) (X), dist_nonneg (C) (Y), dist_nonneg (A) (Z),
          dist_nonneg (X) (C), dist_nonneg (Y) (A), dist_nonneg (Z) (B)]
      exact h₅
    exact h₄
  case right =>
    have h₁ : sInf {volume (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}), volume (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}), volume (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})} ≤ volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) := by
      apply csInf_le
      exact bddBelow_triple _
      <;> simp [hnoncol, hX, hY, hZ]
      <;>
      (try norm_num) <;>
      (try linarith) <;>
      (try aesop)
    exact h₁
```

theorem putnam_1973_a1
(A B C X Y Z : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))
(hnoncol : ¬Collinear ℝ {A, B, C})
(hX : X ∈ segment ℝ B C)
(hY : Y ∈ segment ℝ C A)
(hZ : Z ∈ segment ℝ A B)
: ((dist B X ≤ dist X C ∧ dist C Y ≤ dist Y A ∧ dist A Z ≤ dist Z B) →
volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C})) ∧
sInf {volume (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}), volume (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}), volume (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})} ≤ volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) := by
  constructor
  · intro h
    have h₁ := h.1
    have h₂ := h.2.1
    have h₃ := h.2.2
    have h₄ : volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C}) := by
      -- Use the fact that the area of the triangle XYZ is at least 1/4 of the area of ABC
      -- This is a known geometric fact that can be derived from the Ravi diagram and the given inequalities

        segment_eq_closed_segment_of_ne (A := C) (B := A) (X := Y),
        segment_eq_closed_segment_of_ne (A := A) (B := B) (X := Z),
        segment_eq_closed_segment_of_ne (A := B) (B := C) (X := X),
        segment_eq_closed_segment_of_ne (A := C) (B := A) (X := Y),
        segment_eq_closed_segment_of_ne (A := A) (B := B) (X := Z)]

      <;>
      (try exact le_of_eq (by ring))

      (try exact le_of_eq (by ring))
    exact h₁

```lean4
theorem putnam_1973_a1
(A B C X Y Z : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))
(hnoncol : ¬Collinear ℝ {A, B, C})
(hX : X ∈ segment ℝ B C)
(hY : Y ∈ segment ℝ C A)
(hZ : Z ∈ segment ℝ A B)
: ((dist B X ≤ dist X C ∧ dist C Y ≤ dist Y A ∧ dist A Z ≤ dist Z B) →
volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C})) ∧
sInf {volume (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}), volume (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}), volume (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})} ≤ volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) := by
  constructor
  · intro h
    have h₁ := h.1
    have h₂ := h.2.1
    have h₃ := h.2.2
    have h₄ : volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) ≥ (1/4) * volume (convexHull ℝ {A, B, C}) := by
      -- Use the fact that the area of the triangle XYZ is at least 1/4 the area of the triangle ABC
      field_simp [volume_convexHull_of_card_three] at hnoncol ⊢
      ring_nf
      norm_num
      <;>
     
      nlinarith [sq_nonneg (dist B X - dist X C), sq_nonneg (dist C Y - dist Y A), sq_nonneg (dist A Z - dist Z B),
        dist_nonneg (B) (X), dist_nonneg (X) (C), dist_nonneg (C) (Y), dist_nonneg (Y) (A), dist_nonneg (A) (Z), dist_nonneg (Z) (B)]
    exact h₄
  · have h₁ : sInf {volume (convexHull ℝ {A, Z, Y}), volume (convexHull ℝ {B, X, Z}), volume (convexHull ℝ {C, Y, X})} ≤ volume (convexHull ℝ {X, Y, Z}) := by
      apply csInf_le
      exact bddBelow_triple_union _ _ _
      simp (config := { contextual := true }) [convexHull_of_card_three]
      <;> aesop
    exact h₁
